FuncDef:
The clock source ptp priority command configures a priority for a PTP clock source.
The undo clock source ptp priority command deletes the configured priority of a PTP clock source. The clock source ptp priority command configures a priority for a PTP clock source. The undo clock source ptp priority command deletes the configured priority of a PTP clock source. By default, a clock source does not have a priority. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority of a clock source.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 255. A smaller value indicates a higher priority.
